title: OPENSEA ANNOUNCEMENT: If You Purchased NFTs on OpenSea, You Are Encouraged to Contact The Rosen Law Firm About Your Rights
summary: OpenSea may have issued materially misleading information to the investing public. The Rosen Law Firm is preparing a class action seeking recovery of investor losses. To join the prospective class action, go to https://rosenlegal.com/submit-form/?case_id=29398.

title: Where Will Cava Stock Be in 5 Years?
summary: Cava Group (CAVA 0.94%) shareholders are sitting fat and happy after the last year. The stock in the Mediterranean restaurant chain is up a whopping 300% in the last 12 months. The recent IPO has become an investor favorite with its strong traffic growth and room to expand its restaurant locations around the nation.

title: 1 Magnificent S&P 500 Dividend Stock Up 3% to Buy and Hold Forever
summary: McDonald's gave investors heartburn in its last few earnings reports, which showed stress on the leading fast-food business. But patient investors should still do well by holding McDonald's stock over the long term. The chain is now within striking distance of joining the exclusive club of Dividend Kings.

title: The Ultimate Growth Stock to Buy With $1,000 Right Now
summary: Amazon (AMZN) is the ultimate growth stock to buy with $1,000 right now. This company benefits from some powerful secular trends, all propelled by the ways in which technology is changing the economy. The company has an unrivaled scale with its logistics operations, the online marketplace, and the Amazon brand.

title: The S&P 500 Just Did This for the First Time in 27 Years. Here's What History Says Happens Next.
summary: The widely followed index hasn't had a run like this since 1997. Since its low point, the S&P 500 has gained roughly 59%, compared to average bull market gains of 180%. History suggests the momentum that has sustained this rally will continue.

title: Legendary Apple Co-Founder Steve Jobs Once Said, 'Being The Richest Man In The Cemetery Doesn't Matter To Me:' Maybe That's Why His Impact Transcends Financial Success For iPhone-Maker And Beyond
summary: It's been over a decade since legendary Apple Inc. co-founder Steve Jobs left us. On Oct. 5, the anniversary of his passing, it's worth taking a moment to reflect on the journey of this tech visionary. Jobs’ story begins in San Francisco, where he was born in 1955.

title: I Know I'll Get Social Security in Retirement. Here's Why I'm Leaving It Out of My Plans
summary: The program's trust funds are expected to be depleted in 2034, according to a recent Congressional Budget Office report. That could lead to benefit cuts if the government cannot find a way to increase Social Security's funding over the long term. The best way to do this is by creating a my Social Security account.

title: 2 High-Yield Dividend Stocks Set to Soar
summary: United Parcel Service (UPS) and LTC Properties Inc. (LTC) are two high-yield dividend stocks that also boast businesses that could take off in the near term. UPS has returned to growth and made key acquisitions. LTC has a bright future as America's population ages and boosts demand for its senior housing and skilled nursing properties.

title: CAE INC. ANNOUNCEMENT: If You Have Suffered Losses in CAE Inc.  ( NYSE: CAE ) , You Are Encouraged to Contact The Rosen Law Firm About Your Rights - CAE  ( NYSE:CAE )
summary: Rosen Law Firm continues to investigate potential securities claims on behalf of shareholders of CAE Inc. CAE may have issued materially misleading business information to the investing public. If you purchased CAE securities you may be entitled to compensation without payment of any out of pocket fees or costs.

title: Polls Suggest This Candidate Holds Slim Lead In Presidential Race With One Month To Go
summary: Kamala Harris is slightly ahead of Donald Trump in the presidential race, as per recent polling data. Recent surveys indicate that Harris is leading Trump by a margin of two to five points. The outcome of the election could hinge on the seven battleground states, where the race is currently too close to call.

title: Mary Trump Says Special Counsel's Filing Counter Ex-President's Efforts To Game Legal System In His Favor
summary: U.S. District Court Judge for the District of Columbia Tanya Chutkan made public this week a filing by Special Prosecutor Jack Smith. Mary Trump, the former president’s niece, on Thursday delved into the development in a substack post. She noted that Smith made the case that Donald Trump acted as a private citizen and a private candidate.

title: Here's How Mark Cuban's Drunken Splurge Of $125,000 Turned Into A Profitable Investment
summary: Mark Cuban once made a spontaneous purchase of a lifetime flight pass from American Airlines. The pass, dubbed the AAirpass, was launched in the early 1980s, providing unlimited first-class travel for life. Cuban acquired the pass in the aftermath of selling his first business, MicroSolutions.

title: 3 Top Utility Stocks to Buy in October
summary: After a huge rally, investors need to be a bit more selective in the utility sector. NextEra Energy's dividend has grown at a 10% annualized clip over the past one-, three-, five-, and 10-year periods. Black Hills' natural gas and electric utility serves 1.3 million customers in parts of Arkansas, Colorado, Iowa, Kansas, Montana, South Dakota and Nebraska.

title: 1 Wall Street Analyst Thinks Tesla Stock Is Going to $310. Is It a Buy?
summary: The stock is trading down after Tesla reported its production and delivery numbers for the third quarter. Morgan Stanley analyst Adam Jonas is taking the long view on the company's prospects. The company is making a big push into artificial intelligence (AI) to lay the groundwork for a robotaxi service.

title: HII's Ingalls Shipbuilding Hosts Student Maritime Welding Competition
summary: HII’s (NYSE: HII) Ingalls Shipbuilding division hosted their second annual Project MFG Maritime Welding Competition. The competition served as an opportunity to highlight the vital role of skilled trades in the manufacturing industry. The first, second and third place winners received prizes and all of the participants received contingent employment offers.

title: Down 45% in 6 Months, Is Dollar General Stock Too Cheap to Pass Up?
summary: Dollar General (DG) is down more than 45% in the past six months. Same-store sales rose just 0.5% for the quarter ended Aug. 2, while operating profits nosedived 21% year over year. The retail stock is now trading near a seven-year low.

title: Want the Max $4,873 Social Security Benefit? Here's the Salary You Need.
summary: Social Security was never intended to provide all of anyone's retirement income. That doesn't mean you shouldn't get the most you can out of the entitlement program. Earn enough money to make the maximum allowable contributions to the government-administered program.

title: Is Apple a Buy, Sell, or Hold in 2025?
summary: Apple's (AAPL) stock has underperformed the market by 2 percentage points since the start of the year, increasing 18.3%. The company has had a lot of success in the past and richly rewarded shareholders. Apple's iPhone accounts for a large portion of the company's sales.

title: Jeff Bezos Swears By This One-Hour Rule For Success - Now Neuroscience Backs It Up - Amazon.com  ( NASDAQ:AMZN )
summary: Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, has a distinctive morning routine that avoids screen time for the first hour of the day. Recent neuroscience research indicates that this method could lead to smarter, healthier days. Bezos is convinced that this slow, phone-free start enhances his energy and decision-making abilities.

title: Here's Why Bill Gates Drops To Historic Low On Forbes 400 List
summary: Gates has slipped to the ninth position, a significant drop from his sixth place ranking last year. His net worth has also seen a $4 billion decrease from the previous year. This marks the first time since 1991 that Gates has not featured among the top ten wealthiest individuals globally.

title: Biden Anticipates Potential Unrest In Upcoming Election: 'Trump Has Said Very Dangerous Things'
summary: President Joe Biden made his first-ever appearance at a regular White House press briefing on Friday. During the briefing, Biden voiced his doubts about the peaceful conclusion of the upcoming election. The President’s concerns stem from the rhetoric of former President Donald Trump.

title: Trump's Dark Rhetoric: Migrants Portrayed As Criminals Amid Election Heat
summary: Donald Trump made unfounded claims that migrants crossing the U.S. border were responsible for widespread violence. Trump labeled migrants from Mexico as criminals 13 times and those from Guatemala 10 times from Sept. 1, 2023, to Oct. 2, 2024.
